unparsed_output:
This appears to be a typed report on an 8.5 by 11" sheet of paper with a typewriter. It is the first of two pages of the "Report of the International Special Projects Committee" of the American Phytopathological Society, dated August 22, 1967.

The committee report discusses the impact of population growth on the development and distribution of rice. The committee recommends that developed nations feed their own nations and increase agricultural productivity instead of donating food to developing nations. The committee also recommends that new technology be used to make more efficient use of resources such as water, fertilizer, and improved varieties.

Overall, the report presents a thorough and well-researched analysis of the issues surrounding rice production and distribution. It highlights the need for more efficient use of resources and the development of new technology to address the challenges posed by population growth.
